item.title: A Man Was Caught Smuggling Almost 14 Percent of an Entire Species
item.description:
Last week at the Suvarnabhumi International Airport in Bangkok authorities arrested a Thai man after discovering 54 Ploughshare Tortoises in a suitcase he retrieved from a luggage carousel. That’s a lot of tortoises, particularly when you consider that the Ploughshare is one of the rarest species on the planet, numbering just 400 around the world. [...]

item.dc:creator: Andrew Liszewski

item.title: HTC One Teardown: Even Harder to Fix Than the iPhone
item.description:
The HTC One is hands-down the most beautiful Android phone we’ve ever seen, so it should come as no surprise that it doesn’t come apart nicely. The folks over at iFixit gave it a shot and had One hell of a time getting the guts out so you won’t have to. And you shouldn’t try; [...]

item.title: Watch These Classic Movie Trailers Re-Purposed for Vine
item.description:
Trailer-editing professionals TOKYO experimented with Vine recently by re-editing a handful of trailers into six-second, near seizure-inducing cinematic bursts inspired by The Wolverine Vine trailer. You’ve never seen Aliens like this. ALIENS (1986) – Retweased by TOKYO for @glasseyehq – Follow @retweaser vine.co/v/bjJ0LWJ9u2J — retweaser (@retweaser) March 27, 2013 GoodFellas (1990) – Retweased by TOKYO [...]

item.title: See You In 20 Years’ Time, 3D
item.description:
It’s not too often that I make a tech prediction that actually comes true, although like many people, I prefer to think I’m better at it than I really am. Still, when one does come out as I foretold I am not immune to rubbing my hands with glee and smiling with a cheeky grin, [...]

item.title: Facebook Is Going to Have a New Home on Android
item.description: Facebook just invited the press to an event at Facebook HQ that’ll show off Facebook’s “new home on Android”. Is this the much talked about (and denied) Facebook phone? Will Facebook be using the Android OS to build a layer of Facebook on top of? HMM. Or is this just some new version of the Android Facebook app? [...]
item.dc:creator: Casey Chan

item.title: Toilets in Video Games Are All Pretty Gross
item.description:
Though most video games never involve a player having too drop a deuce, video game worlds always seem to have dirty toilets in even dirtier restrooms. Who uses these toilets and why are they universally dirty! Video Game Toilets rounds up the toilets found in video games—it spans from like the early 80′s until now—in [...]

item.title: Do You Reckon These Bacon Condoms Are an Early April Fool’s?
item.description:
With the first of next month just round the corner, it’s quite possible that these bacon condoms are nothing but a joke. In fact, I dearly hope that they’re a joke, because the alternative — a condom that ‘makes your meat look like meat’ really existing is terryifying and undoubtedly signals the end of civilisation [...]

item.title: Adidas Energy Boost Running Shoes Review: For Once, New Shoes Which Live Up to the Hype
item.description:
Adidas isn’t the first company you think of when you think running. But its new Energy Boost shoes are getting a lot of hype. “Breakthrough for running shoes,” it says. Big claims, but surprisingly, backed up by the performance.   What Is It Running shoes made from a new material called Boost, as opposed to [...]

item.title: North Korea Is Putting Its Rockets on Standby for Fire After the US Made a Show of Force with Stealth Bombers
item.description:
According to Reuters, North Korea has readied its rockets to attack US military bases in South Korea and the Pacific Ocean after the US made a show of force by flying stealth bombers over South Korea. Kim Jong Un had apparently signed off an order for North Korea’s rockets to be “on standby for fire”. [...]

item.description:
If you have kids, it’s never too soon to start thinking about back to school. So keep these adorable Rubber Barber erasers, designed by Chen Lu Wei, in the back of your mind for when it’s time to start shopping for school supplies again. Out of the box they look like a set of square-headed [...]

item.description:
These sand sculptures were prepared as part of this year’s Hollywood-themed Weston-Super-Mare Sand Sculpture festival on March 26, 2013. item.title: Less Is More for Spotify’s New and Improved Logo
item.description:
Spotify has a new logo. It’s been pared down, lost its cutesy aesthetic, and thanks to a little simplicity looks better overall. The old, over-stylised branding bounced at you like a candy pop music beat. On the other hand, the new 2D look is spelled out in Proxima Nova font, and it’s simple and clean. [...]

item.description:
There’s been no shortage of Mars pictures since Curiosity landed. We’ve got Martian mountains, rover selfies, the works. But thanks to a little image stitching by a clever dude back here on Earth, now we have Mars Street View, kind of. Photographer Andrew Bodrov took a whopping 407 of the pictures Curiosity took with its [...]

item.title: What’s the Safest Seat in an Airplane?
item.description: The truth is that, statistically, planes are one of the safest ways to travel. But with that being said, even walking out your front door is going to come with its fair share of risks. So for all you hyper-paranoid aerophobes out there, Channel 4 is producing a documentary—The Crash—that attempts to officially settle, once [...]

item.title: Hack a Can of Compressed Air So It’s Refillable
item.description:
It’s useful for blasting dust, crumbs, and other crap off your keyboard and electronics, but those overpriced compressed air cans are almost as big a rip-off as printer ink. So here’s a brilliant and relatively simple hack that makes a compressed air can refillable with a standard tyre pump. And just to highlight what’s probably [...]

item.description: Camping purists may prefer to eschew traditional toilet paper in favour of nature’s very own brand of sticks and leaves, but to the untrained eye, becoming one with Mother Earth might might leave a lasting, painful reminder on those tender, poison-ivy-scrubbed nether regions. item.title: So Why Do We Get Goosebumps When We’re Cold or Scared?
item.description:
Have you ever wondered why your skin gets covered in tiny bumps when you step out of the shower, or when your body’s fight or flight instincts kick in? The goosebumps phenomenon, named after the way a large bird looks after being plucked, is actually your body’s attempt to protect itself. Tiny muscles connected to [...]

item.title: Razer Edge Review: So Heavy, So Expensive, So Awesome
item.description:
A gaming laptop in a tablet. It’s a thought experiment that raises a whole host of questions: Is that even possible? Can it possibly be good? Would anyone even want it if it were? And finally: How much does it cost? The Razer Edge’s answers translate roughly to “Yes!”, “Sort of.”, “Maybe?”, and “Erm, you [...]

item.title: The British are the Bad Guys in Falkland Islands Counter-Strike
item.description:
An Argentinian map pack for ever-popular online shooter Counter-Strike lets locals fight to liberate the islands from British rule, letting the Argies play as the police as dumping the Brits in the role of terrorists. The map pack, which was developed by local company Dattatec, offers gamers an abridged version of the island, taking in [...]

item.title: Microsoft Released 1,558 Pieces of “Content” to Authorities in 2012
item.description:
Microsoft has updated the world on its interactions with the security forces of the world, revealing that it received 75,378 separate requests for information from police and local security services around the world during 2012. Of those featured in its Law Enforcement Requests Report, only 1,558 resulted in Microsoft yielding and releasing actual user “content” of [...]

item.title: Three Crazy James Bond Villains Were Caught Trying to Cut Through The Internet’s Undersea Cables
item.description:
While the Internet at large was freaking out about an apocalyptic attack that wasn’t really happening yesterday, something nefarious was going down at the bottom of the sea. item.title: Hey Look We Found Tatooine In Real Life
item.description:
French astronomers think they found Tatooine in real life and we didn’t even have to travel to a galaxy far, far away (well, it’s still kind of far). The fictional home of Luke Skywalker is called 2MASS0103(AB)b in real life and it revolves around two suns that move relatively close together. Basically, this planet is [...]
